New Records: Virat Kohli is now the stand-alone record holder for the most one-day international (ODI) centuries with 50.
Key Match Events: India was made to work for every run due to tight bowling and aggressive fielding
Head and Marnus Labuschagne put their heads down to construct a match-turning 192-run partnership
Australia won the match by 6 wickets
Pre-Game Insights: Cummins winning the toss and electing to field was a masterstroke
Australia thought it was a good night to chase down and it might get a little bit easier
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma said they tried everything they could from their side, but it wasnâ€™t meant to be
Captain Pat Cummins said they saved their best for last and a couple of big-match players stood up
Virat Kohli was named Player of the Tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: India played with great spirit and brought immense pride to the nation according to the Indian prime minister
The pitch definitely improved under the lights
Australia won their sixth ODI World Cup title
